item.title: Maduro declared winner of disputed Venezuelan election
item.dc:creator: Samantha Schmidt, Ana Herrero, María Luisa Paúl
item.description: The opposition, which had warned of the potential for fraud, was expected to challenge the result.

item.title: Palestinians recount deadly abuse in Israeli prisons: ‘It is Guantánamo’
item.dc:creator: Loveday Morris, Sufian Taha
item.description: The Post spoke to former Palestinian prisoners and lawyers and reviewed autopsy reports, revealing rampant violence and deprivation in Israel’s prison system.

item.title: Cabinet authorizes Netanyahu to decide response to Golan Heights strike
item.dc:creator: Rachel Pannett
item.description: As tensions rise after a deadly rocket attack launched from Lebanon, diplomats are urging restraint to prevent the war in Gaza from spilling into a regional conflict.

item.title: Simone Biles urged her to endure. Now she’s Biles’s top challenger.
item.dc:creator: Marina Dias, Terrence McCoy
item.description: The reigning world champion all-rounder and her Brazilian runner-up have formed a mutual admiration society.

item.title: In Sudan’s catastrophe, food runs out as guns flow freely
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: The effects of the war in Sudan can be measured in superlatives: the world’s biggest internal displacement crisis, largest education crisis and biggest hunger crisis.

item.title: Warring parties in Sudan accused of carrying out wave of rapes
item.dc:creator: Katharine Houreld, Hafiz Haroun
item.description: Allegations by Human Rights Watch that captive women were repeatedly raped jibes with Washington Post reporting from inside Sudan.

item.title: Paris Olympics organizers sorry for Last Supper at Opening Ceremonies
item.dc:creator: Anika Seth
item.description: The tableau included a woman in the role of Jesus and drag queens and gay icons as disciples. It was crashed by a man in blue as Dionysus, the Greek god of revelry.

item.title: Israel strikes deep in Lebanon after rocket attack, stoking fear of wider war
item.dc:creator: Heidi Levine, Rachel Pannett, Niha Masih, Kareem Fahim, Jennifer Hassan, Steve Hendrix
item.description: Israel had promised revenge for a rocket strike from Lebanon that killed 12 in the Golan Heights town of Majdal Shams. Hezbollah denied responsibility.

item.title: Trump vs. Biden on immigration: 12 charts comparing U.S. border security
item.dc:creator: Nick Miroff, Maria Sacchetti, Sarah Frostenson
item.description: Here are 12 charts showing the state of the United States immigration system and the southern border under Biden vs. Trump.

item.title: How India’s warm embrace of Kamala Harris grew chilly
item.dc:creator: Karishma Mehrotra, Anika Seth
item.description: India was excited about Kamala Harris in 2020. Four years later, the reaction to her presidential bid is more complicated.

item.title: F-16 fighter jets arrive in Ukraine but may not tip advantage against Russia
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Khurshudyan, Alex Horton, Emily Rauhala, Siobhán O'Grady
item.description: Ukrainian and Western officials now caution that the aircraft once championed by Kyiv as a game changer are unlikely to make an immediate impact on the battlefield.

item.title: Canada owes First Nations for treaty breaches, top court rules
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall
item.description: The negotiated settlement is expected to be sizable after Canada’s top court ruled that the government “made a mockery” of the 1850 Robinson Treaties.

item.title: Attacks in Gaza and Golan Heights kill more than 40, many of them children
item.dc:creator: Louisa Loveluck, Mohamad El Chamaa, Kareem Fahim, Hajar Harb, Helier Cheung
item.description: An Israeli strike in Gaza killed at least 30 people. In the Israeli-occupied Golan Heights, a rocket attack the military blamed on Hezbollah left 11 people dead.

item.title: After ‘big show’ in U.S., Netanyahu returns to turmoil at home
item.dc:creator: Steve Hendrix
item.description: The prime minster’s inner circle was largely satisfied with the trip — but it might not solve Netanyahu’s cratering popularity among the Israeli electorate.

item.title: How many athletes are in the Paris Olympics, and other key numbers
item.dc:creator: Adela Suliman, Samuel Granados
item.description: The Paris Olympic Games will see about 11,040 athletes take part in 32 sports including athletics, basketball and rowing. Here are the numbers you need to know.

item.title: In Miami, Venezuelan diaspora anxiously watches a vote it can’t participate in
item.dc:creator: Christine Armario
item.description: Many Venezuelans in the United States would like to cast ballots against Nicolás Maduro. But the vast majority won’t be able to vote in what could be a consequential election.

item.title: Netanyahu’s U.S. visit revealed ‘no workable plan’ for peace, critics say
item.dc:creator: Abigail Hauslohner, Louisa Loveluck
item.description: A “day after” plan in Gaza is a critical component of President Biden’s vision for peace. Lawmakers say that, for all the effort, it remains a pipe dream.

item.title: U.S., Japan to unveil first steps towards enhanced military alliance
item.dc:creator: Ellen Nakashima, Michelle Lee
item.description: Biden administration looks to strengthen deterrence against China with a new joint operational command in Japan.

item.title: If Maduro loses, will he cede power? Venezuela’s election, explained.
item.dc:creator: Samantha Schmidt, Ana Herrero
item.description: The opposition is hoping for a victory so overwhelming that the authoritarian socialist will be compelled to negotiate a transition.
